intro: Ilex maingayi, commonly known as Maingay's holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ilex maingayi typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas.
